question: Which of the following gene is constitutively expressed in E. coli?
exp: Genes can be broadly divided into types based on their expression pattern: Constitutively expressed genes Regulated genes House-keeping genes Inducible/repressible Transcribed at a constant level Transcribed depending upon the environmental conditions Eg: Glycolytic enzymes Ribosomal RNA and proteins Eg: UDP-glucuronosyl transferase Lac I gene is constitutively regulated. Lac Z, Lac Y and Lac A genes are regulated by induction/repression.

question: Lac operon is:
exp: Lac operon Inducible operon Because at first it is suppressed most of the times If required it can be induced/Activated.

question: The commonest form of DNA variation is:
exp: SNPs most common polymorphisms. There are 3 million SNPs in the human genome. A single nucleotide at a paicular location is variable

question: The aim of ENCODE project is
exp: Human genome is sequenced, but needs to be annotated. Annotation is the process of identifying the function of each DNA element. ENCODE (Encyclopaedia of DNA elements) To provide a detailed, biochemically informative representation of the human genome using high-throughput sequencing methods to identify and catalogue the functional elements.
opc: To identify the functional elements of human genome

question: Most lethal karyotype is?
exp: Most lethal karyotype is 45, YO Monosomy is more dangerous than trisomy. Turner Syndrome(X0) is only monosomy compatible with life. 45, YO karotype is fetal in utero and not compatible with life Monosomy In Autosomes In Sex Chromosome Not found Lethal Turner Syndrome (XO) Viable

question: The number of base pairs in human diploid genome are:
exp: Genome Base pairs Haploid 3 billion Diploid 3 x 2 = 6 billion Value based one liners Average size of a gene 27, 000 bp Protein coding genes 19000 to 20000 only Percentage of exons 1-2 % of human genome Percentage of Adenine in human genome 54 % (most abundant base) Longest/ largest gene DMD gene, codes for muscle protein Dystrophin Largest protein Titin Most abundant proteins in mammals Collagen Number of proteins in human body > 2. 5 lakh Number of SNPs in human genome 3 million Maximum number of genes are present for Olfactory receptors
